event.title: a 25.2 percent decrease from 141 at the 2000

data.event: The population was 105 at the 2010 census, a 25.2 percent decrease from 141 at the 2000 census.

event.title: began along the route of the Missouri-Kansas-Texas Railroad (Katy) in 1872

data.event: The town of Armstrong began along the route of the Missouri-Kansas-Texas Railroad (Katy) in 1872.
In 1896, another post office opened in Armstrong, but it was closed in 1920.
In 1896, another post office opened in Armstrong, but it was closed in 1920.

event.title: now the Department of Wildlife Conservation) established

data.event: The Oklahoma Office of the Game Warden (now the Department of Wildlife Conservation) established a fish hatchery in the town about 1916.

event.title: were attracted to the Blue River and nearby Lake Texoma, By 1980

data.event: Otherwise the town survived economically by serving small farms in the area and catering to the needs of sport fishermen who were attracted to the Blue River and nearby Lake Texoma, By 1980, the town had 133 residents.
The population dropped to 122 in 1990, then rose to 141 in 2000.
The population dropped to 122 in 1990, then rose to 141 in 2000.
It dropped again, and was 105 in 2010.
